numlitem.para: Both A/C packs and pressurization system are operative,
Dispatch is prohibited for OAT above 41 degrees C at departure and destination,
Aircraft remains at or below FL350,

For -200 passenger, combi, and STC ST03562AT procedures are established and used to ensure aft lower cargo compartment remains empty or is verified to contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), and/or Fly Away Kits,

For -200PF and -200SF, procedures are established and used to ensure forward lower cargo compartment remains empty or is verified to contain only empty cargo handling equipment, ballast (ballast may be loaded in ULDs), and/or Fly Away Kits,
For ground operations, at least one pack is operating for OAT above 18 degrees C,
For ground operations, both packs are operating for OAT above 32 degrees C, and
For passenger and combi ground operations, weather radar remains OFF except for weather evaluation just before takeoff.

note.para: When recirculation fan is unpowered, DIM function of Indicator Lights system will be inoperative.
UPS does not carry Fly Away Kits in voided cargo compartments.

numlitem.para: Limit flight altitude to FL350.
For ground operations, operate at least one pack for OAT above 18ºC and both packs for OAT above 32ºC.

When airborne, observe the (normal) status message "OVBD EX VAL OPEN" is displayed. This indicates the exhaust valve is operating in the desired smoke position providing cooling airflow from differential pressure.
On engine shutdown, observe the EICAS messages to be displayed:
FWD EQ EXH SNSR (MX LEVEL)
EQPT CLG SENSOR (STATUS LEVEL)
Erase these messages prior to each flight. If messages do not clear, maintenance action is required.

Ensure the Load Supervisor or authorized personnel has signed the load manifest. This signature indicates that the load planning system has accounted for any aircraft load restriction resulting from the inoperative equipment and that the aircraft has been loaded in accordance with all UPS weight and balance limitations.

note.para: When recirculation fan is turned off or inoperative, the associated pack goes to High Flow mode increasing fuel burn. Add 0.3% to flight plan fuel.

numlitem.para: Limit flight altitude to FL350.
Forward lower cargo compartment remains empty.
Dispatch is prohibited for OAT above 41ºC at departure and destination.

note.para: When recirculation fan is turned off or inoperative, the associated pack goes to High Flow mode increasing fuel burn. Add 0.3% to flight plan fuel.

placard.para: Placard Recirc Fan switch "INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

numlitem.para: Observe two advisory level EICAS messages, EQPT OVHT and L RECIRC FAN displayed, OVHT light illuminated and ground crew warning horn will sound.

To extinguish the EQPT OVHT message, light and horn, locate the forward equipment exhaust low flow sensor TS 5293 through the forward E/E compartment tunnel right side of nosewheel well. Remove cap and stow connector D7190.

note.para: The fan "INOP" light will remain illuminated. All other functions of EQPT OVHT message light will remain operative.

numlitem.para: Prior to each flight, erase the EICAS messages displayed in item (4) of the Operations Procedure section.
When forward cargo compartment is to be voided, ensure all contents are removed from the PFM Box. Include the statement "PFM Box verified empty" in the deferral statement.
